noun.description: An opinion or conclusion formed on the basis of incomplete information.
examples: conjectures about the newcomer were many and varied
the purpose of the opening in the wall is open to conjecture

verb.description: Form an opinion or supposition about (something) on the basis of incomplete information.
examples: many conjectured that the jury could not agree
he conjectured the existence of an otherwise unknown feature

origin: Late Middle English (in the senses to divine and divination): from Old French, or from Latin conjectura, from conicere put together in thought, from con- together + jacere throw.
